intro: Cuervea isangiensis, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture. Cuervea isangiensis is known for its milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of the Apocynaceae family.
